intro: Amsinckia tessellata var. elegans, commonly known as the elegant brickfruit, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, round, edible fruits that resemble small bricks. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to rock gardens and dry landscapes. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
